docs.lead_paragraph: Iodine has used online surveys to compile data on Americans’ experiences while taking prescription medications, intending to help other prospective users educate themselves.

headline.main: To Gather Drug Data, a Health Start-Up Turns to Consumers
headline.print_headline: To Gather Drug Data, a Health Start-Up Turns to Consumers

docs.abstract: New health start-up Iodine uses online surveys to compile data on Americans’ experiences while taking prescription medications; goal is to help other prospective users educate themselves through drug-taking information and advice.
docs.snippet: Iodine has used online surveys to compile data on Americans’ experiences while taking prescription medications, intending to help other prospective users educate themselves.

docs.lead_paragraph: The Obama administration says consumers in most states will have more insurance options next year under the president's health care law.

headline.main: More Insurers to Offer Health Law Plans Next Year
headline.print_headline: More Insurers to Offer Health Law Plans Next Year

docs.snippet: The Obama administration says consumers in most states will have more insurance options next year under the president's health care law.

docs.lead_paragraph: The number of insurers offering individual health plans on the Obamacare exchanges will increase about 25 percent in 2015 and that should keep down prices, the U.S. Department of Health and Human Services said on Tuesday in a report.

headline.main: U.S. Government Health Agency Sees 25 Percent Increase in Obamacare Insurers
headline.print_headline: U.S. Government Health Agency Sees 25 Percent Increase in Obamacare Insurers

docs.lead_paragraph: Regulators from the United States and elsewhere should coordinate better how they levy fines on banks for misconduct to avoid making it harder to rebuild strength in the banking system, Bank of England Deputy Governor Andrew Bailey said.

headline.main: BoE's Bailey Wants Better Global Coordination Over Bank Fines
headline.print_headline: BoE's Bailey Wants Better Global Coordination Over Bank Fines

docs.snippet: Regulators from the United States and elsewhere should coordinate better how they levy fines on banks for misconduct to avoid making it harder to rebuild strength in the banking system, Bank of England Deputy Governor Andrew Bailey said.

docs.lead_paragraph: The government's own watchdogs tried to hack into HealthCare.gov earlier this year and found what they termed a critical vulnerability — but also came away with respect for some of the health insurance site's security features.

headline.main: Government Hackers Try to Crack HealthCare.gov
headline.print_headline: Government Hackers Try to Crack HealthCare.gov

docs.snippet: The government's own watchdogs tried to hack into HealthCare.gov earlier this year and found what they termed a critical vulnerability — but also came away with respect for some of the health insurance site's security features.

docs.lead_paragraph: Federal health officials said the shorter application on HealthCare.gov has fewer pages and fewer screens to navigate, and allows people to sign up with fewer clicks.

headline.print_headline: Health Care Website Is Given Overhaul

docs.abstract: Obama administration is redesigning HealthCare.gov and says 70 percent of consumers will be able to use shorter, simpler online application form to buy health insurance when second annual open enrollment period begins in November 2014.
docs.snippet: Federal health officials said the shorter application on HealthCare.gov has fewer pages and fewer screens to navigate, and allows people to sign up with fewer clicks.
